A2 from the beginning to the end of a particular period: They work during the night and sleep by day. There were huge advances in aviation technology during the Second World War. Compare
while conjunction (DURING)
More examplesFewer examplesThe (traffic) congestion in the city gets even worse during the summer.The work that the students do during the year will count towards their final degrees.The city centre's quite quite lively during the day, but it's totally dead at night.You're not allowed to talk during the exam.Jean was my roommate during our first year at university.

(AT SOME TIME IN)

Grammar
DuringWe use during before nouns and noun phrases to refer to when something happens over a period of time. During can refer to the whole time of the event: …
During or for?We use during to say when something happens, if it happens in or over a period of time. We use for to talk about the length of time something lasts. …
